medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse abdominal pain with focal RLQ pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours prior to presentation, starting as diffuse abdominal pain, which progressed to more focal right lower quadrant pain. The patient also endorses nausea but has not vomited. No fever, chills, or changes in bowel habits noted. Symptoms have limited her food intake today.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of pneumonia (PNA) post 5 days of azithromycin, acute on chronic left-sided headaches, suspected migraines most likely tension headaches, left knee pain, heel pain, back pain, depression, anxiety, vitamin B12 deficiency with paresthesias.
